laws.summary: Non-compete agreements are ENFORCEABLE if reasonable
laws.statute_citation: Alabama Code ยง 8-1-190 et seq.
requirements: Non-compete agreements are ENFORCEABLE if reasonable

Alabama enforces non-competes that are reasonable in time (typically 2 years max), geography, and scope. Must protect legitimate business interest. Blue-pencil doctrine does NOT apply - entire agreement may be void if unreasonable.
Best practice: Keep time limit to 2 years or less, reasonable geographic scope tied to actual business territory
Action required: Ensure reasonableness in all three factors: time, geography, scope
laws.notes: Alabama enforces non-competes that are reasonable in time (typically 2 years max), geography, and scope. Must protect legitimate business interest. Blue-pencil doctrine does NOT apply - entire agreement may be void if unreasonable.

laws.summary: Salary history inquiries are PERMITTED in Alabama
requirements: Salary history inquiries are PERMITTED in Alabama
Alabama has no state law prohibiting employers from asking about salary history. Employers may inquire about previous compensation.
Action required: No restrictions - permitted by state law
laws.notes: Alabama has no state law prohibiting employers from asking about salary history. Employers may inquire about previous compensation.

laws.summary: NO pay transparency or salary disclosure requirements
requirements: NO pay transparency or salary disclosure requirements
Alabama does not require employers to disclose salary ranges in job postings or to applicants.
Action required: No action required - optional disclosure
laws.notes: Alabama does not require employers to disclose salary ranges in job postings or to applicants.

laws.summary: Background checks permitted at any stage - NO ban-the-box law
requirements: Background checks permitted at any stage - NO ban-the-box law
Alabama has no statewide ban-the-box restrictions. Criminal history can be inquired about on applications. Must comply with federal FCRA requirements for background checks.
Action required: Follow federal FCRA procedures only
laws.notes: Alabama has no statewide ban-the-box restrictions. Criminal history can be inquired about on applications. Must comply with federal FCRA requirements for background checks.

requirements: Drug testing PERMITTED and ENCOURAGED
Alabama allows pre-employment, random, reasonable suspicion, and post-accident drug testing. Employers with certified drug-free workplace programs receive workers' compensation premium discounts.
Best practice: Drug testing is legal and can provide workers' comp benefits
Action required: Ensure testing procedures are documented if implementing program
laws.notes: Alabama allows pre-employment, random, reasonable suspicion, and post-accident drug testing. Employers with certified drug-free workplace programs receive workers' compensation premium discounts.

requirements: Arbitration agreements are ENFORCEABLE
Alabama follows the Federal Arbitration Act. Mandatory arbitration clauses are generally enforceable if not unconscionable.
Best practice: Arbitration agreements are acceptable - ensure fairness standards
Action required: Ensure clause provides fair procedures
laws.notes: Alabama follows the Federal Arbitration Act. Mandatory arbitration clauses are generally enforceable if not unconscionable.

laws.summary: At-will employment STRONGLY PROTECTED in Alabama
requirements: At-will employment STRONGLY PROTECTED in Alabama
Alabama is a strong at-will employment state with very limited exceptions. Employment is presumed at-will unless modified by clear contract.
Best practice: Strong at-will language recommended and legally protective
laws.notes: Alabama is a strong at-will employment state with very limited exceptions. Employment is presumed at-will unless modified by clear contract.

laws.summary: NO state minimum wage - federal $7.25/hour applies
requirements: NO state minimum wage - federal $7.25/hour applies
Alabama has no state minimum wage law. Federal minimum wage of $7.25/hour applies under FLSA.
Action required: Ensure compliance with federal minimum wage
Must meet federal minimum wage of $7.25/hour
laws.notes: Alabama has no state minimum wage law. Federal minimum wage of $7.25/hour applies under FLSA.

laws.summary: NO state-mandated paid sick leave or paid family leave
requirements: NO state-mandated paid sick leave or paid family leave
Alabama does not require employers to provide paid sick leave, paid family leave, or vacation time. Federal FMLA may apply for eligible employers (50+ employees).
Action required: No state requirements - federal FMLA only for eligible employers
laws.notes: Alabama does not require employers to provide paid sick leave, paid family leave, or vacation time. Federal FMLA may apply for eligible employers (50+ employees).

laws.summary: Final paycheck timing not specified by state law
requirements: Final paycheck timing not specified by state law
Alabama has no specific law requiring payment of final wages by a certain deadline. Best practice is next regular payday or within reasonable time.
Action required: Follow company policy or next regular payday
laws.notes: Alabama has no specific law requiring payment of final wages by a certain deadline. Best practice is next regular payday or within reasonable time.

laws.summary: Alabama is a RIGHT TO WORK state
laws.statute_citation: Alabama Constitution Amendment 772 & Alabama Code ยง 25-7-30
requirements: Alabama is a RIGHT TO WORK state
Employees cannot be required to join or pay dues to a union as a condition of employment. Union membership and payment of dues must be voluntary.
Action required: Cannot require union membership or dues payment
laws.notes: Employees cannot be required to join or pay dues to a union as a condition of employment. Union membership and payment of dues must be voluntary.

laws.summary: NO required meal or rest breaks for adults
requirements: NO required meal or rest breaks for adults
Alabama does not require employers to provide meal breaks or rest breaks to employees 16 years or older. Federal law requires breaks under 20 minutes be paid if provided.
Action required: No state mandate - optional
laws.notes: Alabama does not require employers to provide meal breaks or rest breaks to employees 16 years or older. Federal law requires breaks under 20 minutes be paid if provided.

requirements: Strict child labor restrictions apply
Special rules for employees under 18. Minors under 16 require work certificates. Hour restrictions and prohibited occupations apply.
Action required: Verify age certificates and comply with hour restrictions
laws.notes: Special rules for employees under 18. Minors under 16 require work certificates. Hour restrictions and prohibited occupations apply.
